visuals.title: The Exponential Fourier Series: Analysis and Synthesis
visuals.description: Any periodic signal can be decomposed into complex exponentials e^{jkω₀t}. Analysis extracts coefficients; synthesis reconstructs the signal.

visuals.title: Orthogonality: Why Non-Matching Harmonics Cancel
visuals.description: When you multiply x(t) by e^{−jkω₀t} and integrate, all harmonics except the k-th cancel due to orthogonality. The product of different harmonics integrates to zero.

visuals.title: The Analysis Integral as a Frequency Sieve
visuals.description: Multiplying x(t) by e^{−jkω₀t} and integrating isolates the k-th harmonic. All other harmonics integrate to zero.

visuals.title: The DC Component X₀ = Average Value of x(t)
visuals.description: X₀ = (1/T₀)∫x(t)dt is the average value. Geometrically, it's the area under one period divided by T₀.

visuals.title: EFS Calculation: Step-by-Step
visuals.description: Step 1: Identify T₀ and ω₀. Step 2: Choose integration window. Step 3: Evaluate the analysis integral. Step 4: General formula for X_k.

visuals.title: Any Integration Window of Length T₀ Gives the Same X_k
visuals.description: You can integrate from 0 to T₀, or −T₀/2 to T₀/2, or any interval of length T₀. The result is always the same.

visuals.title: Interactive: Build a Signal from Exponential Harmonics
visuals.description: Add complex exponential harmonics one by one. Watch ±k pairs combine into real sinusoids.

visuals.title: Interactive: Coefficient Calculator
visuals.description: Choose a signal (square, sawtooth, triangle) and see Fourier coefficients computed automatically.

visuals.title: Square Wave Reconstruction: Partial Sum Convergence
visuals.description: As more harmonics are added, the approximation improves. Near discontinuities, ~9% Gibbs overshoot persists.

visuals.title: Interactive: The Gibbs Overshoot
visuals.description: Increase the number of harmonics and observe the persistent ~9% overshoot at discontinuities.
